programmes.show_description: Su Pollard stars in this Christmas special, as Madge prepares a big show at the Benidorm Palace. The Garveys come and visit, whilst Donald and Jacqueline bring a group of friends to the Solana. S3 E7
When an author friend of Arthur learns her ex-husband has sold her house without permission, she hires Terry to help with ideas and Arthur to help get the money back. S5 E4: The Second Time Around
When Rita gives birth to the newest member of the Garnett family, Alf eventually goes to the hospital to visit his grandson. S4 E1: To Garnett a Grandson
George has been claiming for a non-existent son for the past 19 years in order to fiddle his tax returns, but he is in danger of being caught when a tax inspector visits. S4 E6: My Son, My Son
Several months have passed - Amy is working, but David is still unemployed and lies to her that his doctor has told him he will have a nervous breakdown unless he takes a holiday. S3 E1: Winter Break
Jack invites his friend Jason Dill to stay at the house, but Ozzy and Sharon are put off by the fact that Jack just lets Jason come over without asking for permission. S1 E8: No Vagrancy

Hit '70s sitcom starring Jimmy Jewel and Hylda Baker as brother and sister Eli and Nellie Pledge, who are forced to run a family pickle factory together in Lancashire. S7, E3: The French Disconnection
Hit '70s sitcom starring Jimmy Jewel and Hylda Baker as brother and sister Eli and Nellie Pledge, who are forced to run a family pickle factory together in Lancashire. S7, E4: Get Out of That
We look at the now-preserved Severn Valley line from Kidderminster to Bewdley and explain why these long-closed railways are still remembered with such affection by those who travelled on them.

A selection of live performances from TV music shows in the 1960s for a genuine taste of the best of the '60s!
Dogs are only allowed to travel on the top deck of a bus; when they are as big as Aunt Maud's pet, it is best that they not travel at all... S2 E4: Aunt Maud
When Stan is courting, it leads him into trouble at work; Jack tries to help him out, but conductors don't always know when to stop. S2 E5: Late Again
When Stan loses his uniform outside a cemetery's gates, he has to use his holiday money to buy a new one. S2 E6: Bon Voyage
When Darryl dies, Tracey has to decide what kind of a send-off to give him - Sharon wants it to be nice for the boys and Dorien has got the perfect outfit. S12 E1: Knocking on Heaven's Door
Tracey's house has been burgled during Darryl's funeral, and the family decide that it's up to them to track down their possessions. S12 E2: Too Much of Nothing
Sharon's disapproval of Tracey dating policeman Barry and apparently overlooking Garth's feelings for his dad leads to a major quarrel between the sisters. S12 E3: Tombstone Blues
When Tracey has enough of Dorien entertaining gentlemen callers and Sharon not bringing in a living wage, she throws them both out and they end up in Sharon's old bedsit. S12 E4: Going, Going, Gone

Auntie Vera has got problems with her hips and her defective lifts and tells Sharon and Tracey she is moving in - there's only one room available, though. S12 E5: Tonight I'll Be Staying Here With You
A surprise visitor in the form of attractive Emma turns up at Tracey's house - Tracey is welcoming, Dorien is shocked to the core, and Travis is over the moon. S12 E6: Abandoned Love
When Travis has serious school news that he's scared to break to his mum, Sharon decides she'll pass herself off as Tracey and sort out his problems. S12 E7: Blonde on Blonde
Sharon and Tracey work out that Dorien has an important birthday coming up - and decide that the event calls for a celebration whatever she thinks. S12 E8: Forever Young
Harold has nowhere to take his lady friends and resolves to get himself a bachelor pad, but his love life doesn't go according to plan; meanwhile, Albert has a new lease of life. S4 E5: A Box in Town
Harold has some big political ambitions and holds a local Labour Party meeting at home; Albert, a fervent Tory, sets out to disrupt it. S4 E6: My Old Man's a Tory
Harold reluctantly agrees to take Albert on a nostalgic trip to France to revisit the battlefields where he fought during the First World War. S4 E7: Pilgrim's Progress
The Steptoes go into mourning when Hercules dies of a heart attack at the grand old age of 39 and the replacement horse mysteriously falls ill as well. S5 E1: A Death In The Family
Harold is intending to go on a skiing holiday to Austria on his own, but Albert feels lonely and neglected while Harold gets some last-minute practice in. S5 E2: A Winter's Tale
A sophisticated antiques dealer turns up at the yard and Harold is very impressed, but Albert thinks he's after more than antiques. S5 E3: Any Old Iron
A heavily pregnant young woman turns up looking for Harold who she thinks is the father; he warms to the idea of becoming a dad, but it can only end in pain. S5 E4: Steptoe and Son - and Son!
Harold wants to buy a sports car with his savings but Albert wants a new colour television; Harold gets his car, but Albert has a funny turn that forces him to think again. S5 E5: The Colour Problem
The Steptoes decide to have X-rays taken when Albert's cough gets worse; Albert gets the all-clear, but what about Harold? S5 E6: TB or Not TB?
When the Steptoes find out that the lease is running out on their house and need a bank loan to buy it, the bank manager ends up making them an offer they can't refuse. S5 E7: Men of Property
After being left in an industrial freezer, Terry looks for alternative employment and gets work helping out an old friend in the second hand furniture business. S5 E5: Second Hand Pose
Cilla Black guest stars in this episode, where the Garveys return to Benidorm to find Madge has got herself into trouble. Lesley starts work at the Solana, and brings gormless son Liam along. S4 E1
It's Lip's 18th birthday and he's in for a few surprises. Not least what the Maguires expect of him now he's come of age, and his long-lost mother Monica appearing at his party. S4 E1
George's car fails its MOT and he needs Â£20 to get it fixed - he sells his piano to Robin, but the problem is how to get it upstairs. S5 E2: Right Said George
The house is plunged into confusion and mourning when Rigsby discovers basement tenant Mr Osborne stiff as a board. S3 E7: Suddenly At Home
Cilla Black guest stars in this episode, where the Garveys return to Benidorm to find Madge has got herself into trouble. Lesley starts work at the Solana, and brings gormless son Liam along. S4 E1
After being left in an industrial freezer, Terry looks for alternative employment and gets work helping out an old friend in the second hand furniture business. S5 E5: Second Hand Pose
A sudden windfall sees Alf head straight to the pub for a celebration and think that there's a surefire way of making more money. S4 E2: Pigeon Fancier
It is Chrissy's birthday when she receives a cine camera and projector from her boyfriend Neil, but Larry plans to use it to watch blue movies. S5 E1: The Last Picture Show
David is caught out when Amy tells him that Tommy Wright is dead, so he and Linda adopt disguises to avoid each other's spouses as they plan to move to another hotel. S3 E2: Deja Vu
When Christmas finally arrives, presents are exchanged and the Osbournes are paid a visit by techno DJ Louis Osbourne, Ozzy's son from his first marriage. S1 E9: A Very Ozzy Christmas
A selection of live performances from TV music shows in the 1960s for a genuine taste of the best of the '60s!
Hit 70s sitcom starring Jimmy Jewel and Hylda Baker as brother and sister Eli and Nellie Pledge, forced to run a family pickle factory together in Lancashire. S7, E5: The One That Got Away
Hit 70s sitcom starring Jimmy Jewel and Hylda Baker as brother and sister Eli and Nellie Pledge, forced to run a family pickle factory together in Lancashire. S7, E6: The Visit
Branch lines and secondary routes have always had a special appeal; this programme recalls many such English byways in films made in the 1950s and the 1960s.

A selection of live performances from TV music shows in the 1960s for a genuine taste of the best of the '60s!
There's trouble on the buses as a strike hits the depot, new rotas mean Stan's on an earlier shift, and misses the canteen's lunch opening entirely. S1 E1: The Early Shift
Stan is always nervous when he has a new conductor but this time he is in for a pleasant surprise. S1 E2: The New Conductor
Robin has taken his new girlfriend Angie out on a couple of dates, and now he hopes to bring her back to the flat to have his wicked way with her. S3 E2: Come Into My Parlour
There is a formal dinner dance at the firm where Jo and Chrissy work, but Chrissy's dance partner has injured himself and so Robin becomes her partner instead. S3 E3: I Won't Dance, Don't Ask Me
Jo sees a mouse in her bedroom and refuses to sleep in there; much to Chrissy's dismay, Jo swaps with Robin while the mouse is on the loose. S3 E4: Of Mice And Women
Chrissy receives flowers and chocolates from a secret admirer; it turns out that they were meant for Jo and that the admirer had wrongly assumed her to be Chrissy. S3 E5: Somebody Out there Likes Me
When Mildred is away visiting her sister, George attempts to evict the tenants so that he and Jerry can convert the flat into separate units to increase rental income. S3 E6: We Shall Not Be Moved
Chrissy takes Robin's place at a weekly card game while he is in hospital having his tonsils removed - and claims that a woman can play cards just as well as a man. S3 E7: Three of a Kind
Robin and Chrissy have borrowed the Ropers' car to drive to Southampton for an Arsenal match, but the car breaks down and they miss the game. S4 E1: Home & Away
Chrissy is practising for her driving test and is receiving lessons from Robin; meanwhile, George has started making home brew liquor which turns out stronger than expected. S4 E2: One for the Road
Albert knocks over Harold's best china cabinet and launches into an elaborate cover-up that includes calling the police to report a break-in. S6 E1: Robbery With Violence
Harold suffers from two left feet and desperately needs someone to teach him how to dance to impress a potential new girlfriend, but who can he ask? S6 E2: Come Dancing
Albert reveals that he is going to get married again and invites the lady round to meet Harold, causing a real shock when she arrives. S6 E3: Two's Company
The battle lines are drawn between the Steptoes as a local by-election looms, and Albert is chosen to take tea with the Prime Minster to Harold's displeasure. S6 E4: Tea For Two
The noise of the nearby motorway convinces Harold that he wants to move to suburbia, and Albert has a brainwave when the local residents association turn up for a chat. S6 E5: Without Prejudice
Harold decides to buy a snooker table and sets it up in the house; when he challenges Albert to a game on the green baize, he is in for a surprise. S6 E6: Pot Black
Harold brings home his latest bargain - a commode he thinks was used by royalty - and the pair get involved in a tug of war over the antique toilet. S6 E7: The Three Feathers
A brash Australian turns up on the doorstep and turns out to be Albert's long-lost son, but Harold doesn't take too kindly to his brother's new business ideas. S6 E8: Cuckoo in the Nest

The vicar calls asking for an article on rag-and-bone men for the church magazine's centenary edition; Harold writes the article but Albert makes the contribution of a crossword. S7 E1: Men of Letters
Harold joins the local amateur dramatic society; when rehearsals take place at the yard, Albert thinks he will give the acting lark a go as well. S7 E2: A Star Is Born
Albert receives news that his brother has died; a family funeral is held and the deceased Steptoe has the last laugh when his will is read out. S7 E3: Oh, What a Beautiful Mourning
Justin James concocts a scheme with a former footballer to obtain tickets for an England v Scotland football match. S5 E6: The Long Ride Back to Scratchwood
Noreen returns to the Solana, with uptight daughter Pauline instead of Geoff. The Garveys go to a water park, where chaos ensues between Mick and Pauline, and Liam works on wooing Sam. S4 E2
Frank struggles to stop Monica telling Sheila that they're still married, but when Monica comes on strong, can he resist her advances?. S4 E2
George needs help finding the answers for all the competitions he enters - luckily, Robin is starting a new job selling encyclopaedias and is looking for his first buyer. S5 E3: A Little Knowledge
A rude surprise lies in store when Rigsby is a little over-enthusiastic with advice after a couple of newlyweds move into the house. S4 E1: Hello Young Lovers
Noreen returns to the Solana, with uptight daughter Pauline instead of Geoff. The Garveys go to a water park, where chaos ensues between Mick and Pauline, and Liam works on wooing Sam. S4 E2
